snippet: While it restructures operations in bankruptcy court, the airline stressed that it still intended to emerge as a stand-alone carrier.
abstract: American Airlines announces that it is willing to consider a merger while it restructures operations in bankruptcy court, but stresses that it still intends to emerge from bankruptcy as a stand-alone carrier; company is facing criticism from labor groups and pressure from rival airlines.
lead_paragraph: While it restructures operations in bankruptcy court, the airline stressed that it still intended to emerge as a stand-alone carrier.

headline.main: Merger Not Ruled Out at American Airlines
headline.print_headline: American Says It Won’t Flatly Rule Out a Merger
